Foxfingers ran down the hall with the Wolf on his heels. "Turn myself 
over?" he asked laughing, "But I'm not done on this side yet." He 
wagged his tail in the air taunting his hosts."I should be fine as 
long as they don't have autoguns down here."

As if on cue he heard the familiar whir and click that the autoguns 
made. "Oh recycled waste." he shouted as he put on the breaks. He 
slid ahead on the smooth surface and stopped about a foot from an 
autogun barrel. It didn't fire. That only meant that these Preds 
didn't want him dead yet. He scampered into the nearest unlocked 
door. He found himself in the engine room. A wrong turn but an 
acceptable one. He ducked behind one of the machines as the autoguns 
in the hall followed. "They wouldn't dare fire at me while I'm in 
here. he thought. If an autogun caused a leak in the engine there'd 
be noone left.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::KitKat::
> 
> She went at full speed. Knowing a wolf can outrun a fox. She 
sniffed 
> him, his scent was getting stronger with each paw step. She grinned.
> "OH FOXY! You know this would be a lot easier if you just turned 
> youself over now. I'm sure your friends would like you returned in 
> one piece and in functioning order."  She smiled. "AUTOGUNS! TAKE 
AIM 
> ON THE FOX SIGNATURE!"
> 
> The autoguns trhoughout the ship came on line and took aim.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > OOC Somehow I knew you'd say that.
> > 
> > Foxfingers had been chased enough times to know he was being 
> herded. 
> > He knew that they wanted him to go this way. He'd continue to 
play 
> > the game a little longer, he might be able to use this to his 
> > advantage. Three bots chasing him meant three more samples for 
> > Veratis. If only Veratis believed in weaponry. He quickly 
scampered 
> > down the hall. A musky smell filled his nostrils. He figured it 
was 
> > the brig. He was playing right into thier hands. Or at least 
thats 
> > what he wanted them to think. KitKat was getting closer, he 
didn't 
> > have to look back to know that, he was staying a step ahead of 
her 
> > both mentally and physically.
> >
